definitions.definition: To engage in trade; to carry on commerce .
To engage in in-store promotion of the sale of goods, as by display and arrangement of goods.
examples: He started his career merchandising in a small clothing store chain.

definitions.definition: To engage in the trade of.
To engage in in-store promotion of the sale of.
examples: He got hired to merchandise some new sporting goods lines.

definitions.definition: To promote as if for sale.
examples: The record companies don't get as good a return on merchandising artists under contract.

main_definition: ( intransitive , archaic ) To engage in trade; to carry on commerce .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To engage in in-store promotion of the sale of goods, as by display and arrangement of goods.
( transitive , archaic ) To engage in the trade of.
( transitive ) To engage in in-store promotion of the sale of.
( transitive ) To promote as if for sale.
